verse: Then I, Daniel, stood on the bank of the Tigris River and looked as two others appeared, one on my side of the river and the other on the far side.
One of them spoke to the man dressed in linen clothing, who was upstream.

I watched and listened carefully. The man dressed in linen clothing who was upstream raised both of his hands into the sky toward heaven. He swore an oath by Him who lives eternally that these disturbing events would last for a time, times, and half a time; and that when the shattering of the power of Godâ€™s holy people comes to an end, then all of this will be over.
I heard what he said but could not understand its meaning.
